SENT.plain: Chronic Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) infection has been linked to lymphoma of gastric mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT), a tumor that is typically localized at presentation
Sporadic Burkitt lymphoma (BL) frequently presents as an abdominal mass
However, primary gastric BL is unusual and the role of H. pylori in its pathogenesis is unclear
We describe a 12 year old with localized gastric BL and concurrent H. pylori infection
In this report, we discuss the potential association between H. pylori and gastric BL and also highlight certain similarities between gastric MALT lymphomas and BL arising in the stomach
